alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Floyd and central Chattooga Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 322 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Summerville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summerville, Trion, Lyerly, Menlo, Berryton, Tidings, Armuchee, Everett Springs and James H. Floyd State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern Georgia.
